gcci.text: With average H100 spot prices around $3.20/hr, persistent supply tightness and lead-time compression are redirecting capex toward pre-emptively contracted clusters and vendor diversification to de-risk access.

gtpi.text: Input pricing averaging $1.25 per 1M tokens signals an intensifying API price war, favoring efficient models and edge inference while squeezing thinner-margin offerings.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load elevates grid strain and carbon footprint concerns, amplifying the need for nuclear adoption and behind-the-meter storage to stabilize cost and emissions.

aipi.text: Despite token price compression and ample hardware speculation, overall sentiment is cautious as investors seek durable unit economics, with growth sustainability hinging on energy cost moderation and disciplined capex.
